Class CorePropsUtils

java.lang.Object
org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CorePropsUtils
public class CorePropsUtils extends Object
Utility-class to work with properties of any Java-object (some extension to JDK's reflection)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <T,V> boolean
    equalProps(T objOne, T objTwo, Function<T,V> getterFunc)
    Comparing on equality of the same property of two objects of the same type.
    static Object
    propValue(Object parent, String... propNameChain)
    Getting the value of nested properties of th-tool-variable by providing the chain of property-names, which is quite the same as Thymeleaf-Engine does when processing the expression of form ${varName.propName.nestedPropName...}.
    static String
    propValueStr(Object parent, String... propNameChain)
    The same as propValue(Object, String...), but cast the final value to string, or transform that value using standard String.valueOf(Object) (which is the same as invoking Object.toString() on that object)

    Methods inherited from class Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • equalProps

      public static <T,V> boolean equalProps(T objOne, T objTwo, Function<T,V> getterFunc)
      Comparing on equality of the same property of two objects of the same type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of both objects
      V - the type of properties (that is inferred once the method reference is provided)
      Parameters:
      objOne - the first object
      objTwo - the second object
      getterFunc - the reference to getter-method
      Returns:
      true if the properties are equal or both are eventually null (and otherwise - false)

    • propValueStr

      public static String propValueStr(Object parent, String... propNameChain)
      The same as propValue(Object, String...), but cast the final value to string, or transform that value using standard String.valueOf(Object) (which is the same as invoking Object.toString() on that object)
      Parameters:
      parent - the root value to start the property-chain
      propNameChain - the chain of nested property-names
      Returns:
      the value of the last property in that property-chain as String

    • propValue

      public static Object propValue(Object parent, String... propNameChain)
      Getting the value of nested properties of th-tool-variable by providing the chain of property-names, which is quite the same as Thymeleaf-Engine does when processing the expression of form ${varName.propName.nestedPropName...}. At the moment only nested objects of type Map<String,Object> are supported.
      Parameters:
      parent - the root value to start the property-chain
      propNameChain - the chain of nested property-names
      Returns:
      the value of the last property in that property-chain
